page.title: 13Housing
page.content: Stogumber Village centre is listed under the{Preservation of {Historic Buildings Act. }Many of the cottages date from the 1600's and are made of{cob with thatch roofs. } The external walls are rendered for protection and painted white. The {Church}rises from the centre of these houses. "Swan Corner Cottage" is reputed to have included in the interior walls the original Village wall. This property has in its life been a public house and is now a private residence. The original Post Office was just a few doors up the hill. Moving away from the Village centre the houses become more modern - {Victorian and then modern day. }There is at present a new housing estate being built on land next to the stream at the lower end of the Village.
